intro: Eriocaulon senile f. pilosum, commonly known as the silver hair spikerush, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and dense, feathery inflorescences. The plant features a distinctive silvery-pubescent appearance, particularly on its leaves and stems, which gives it its common name. It typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. This variety is notable for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in aquatic gardens.
